Most produce keeps better if you don’t wash and cut it until right before you’re going to use it, but sometimes, it’s better to have it already prepped and ready to use! See which works better for your family.

Try prepping vegetables when you get home from the market: put washed apples and peaches in a bowl in the fridge, wrap washed lettuce in a paper towel before storing it in the fridge in a plastic bag; peel and chop winter squash, broccoli, and carrots; put clean celery in a container of water for snacking. Notice if the food gets used more quickly, or if it spoils before you can get to it.
